pullrequest.title: Example notebooks: updates for the first three, plus two new application examples

content.raw:
These look good -- thanks for updating these!  Some minor comments:

1. I've made a few changes to the KH notebook (http://astro.berkeley.edu/~lecoanet/Kelvin%20Helmholtz%20Instability.ipynb).
2. bases-domain: Creating a basis: resolution is in modes now, and I think dealiasing should be 3/2.  We should be specific about what 2/3 vs 3/2 mean.
3. bases-domain: Domains: sin-cos is now implemented.
4. bases-domain: Domains: we should also say what mesh means.
5. fields-operators: can we say more about what set_scale means?  I actually don't understand what it does.
6. fields-operators: Operators: the plot_operators is not working for me...  All I see is the string "(2*(10+f)) + (f*f)" in the bottom left
7. fields-operators: Operators: f.integrate doesn't work
8. problems-solvers: Problems: Don't have add_left_bc anymore
9. problems-solvers: Time-stepping: It would be nice to have some output during the run so that you can tell something is happening!
content.html:
These look good -- thanks for updating these! Some minor comments:

  1. I've made a few changes to the KH notebook (http://astro.berkeley.edu/~lecoanet/Kelvin%20Helmholtz%20Instability.ipynb).
  2. bases-domain: Creating a basis: resolution is in modes now, and I think dealiasing should be 3/2. We should be specific about what 2/3 vs 3/2 mean.
  3. bases-domain: Domains: sin-cos is now implemented.
  4. bases-domain: Domains: we should also say what mesh means.
  5. fields-operators: can we say more about what set_scale means? I actually don't understand what it does.
  6. fields-operators: Operators: the plot_operators is not working for me... All I see is the string "(2(10+f)) + (ff)" in the bottom left
  7. fields-operators: Operators: f.integrate doesn't work
  8. problems-solvers: Problems: Don't have add_left_bc anymore
  9. problems-solvers: Time-stepping: It would be nice to have some output during the run so that you can tell something is happening!

pullrequest.title: Example notebooks: updates for the first three, plus two new application examples

content.raw: All good points.  6 & 7 should have been fixed in the main repo a few week ago.  I can definitely add some info regarding the other points, specifically 4 & 5.  Maybe we should merge this and then address these points with straight pushes, so we don't have to fork and pull to Jeff's fork, etc.?
content.html: All good points. 6 & 7 should have been fixed in the main repo a few week ago. I can definitely add some info regarding the other points, specifically 4 & 5. Maybe we should merge this and then address these points with straight pushes, so we don't have to fork and pull to Jeff's fork, etc.?

pullrequest.title: Example notebooks: updates for the first three, plus two new application examples

content.raw: I agree. Unless there is significant opposition, I will accept this PR later this afternoon.
content.html: I agree. Unless there is significant opposition, I will accept this PR later this afternoon.

content.raw: Another thing -- I think we should have a more comprehensive explanation of how NCCs are specified.  This is briefly mentioned in the TC example, but not really spelled out in its full generality.
content.html: Another thing -- I think we should have a more comprehensive explanation of how NCCs are specified. This is briefly mentioned in the TC example, but not really spelled out in its full generality.
